Consts.useLimit: The geological dataset is under copyright of the Geological Survey of Ireland. This Map is purely representational and is designed for general information and strategic planning use only. Boundaries are interpolated on the basis of data available to the GSI at the time of compilation, from a variety of sources, and local details have been generalised to fit the map scale. The accurracy of data used or interpolations made, is neither stated nor implied. Evaluation of specific sites will normally require further and more detailed assessments, and will frequently require site investigations. The OS 1:100,000 scale base maps are not seamless and are under copyright by Ordnance Survey of Ireland.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
These data represent the latest version of the bedrock geological dataset for Ireland at 1:100,000 scale, including recent 1:50k mapping . The dataset comprises 4 key shape files:

1) Bedrock Polygons_ITM_2018.shp: A polygon shapefile that contains bedrock geological information on Stratigraphy, Igneous units, Lithology and Diagenetic codes, linked to a stratigraphic lexicon.

2) Structural Symbols_100K_ITM_2018: A point shapefile that contains structural symbols and dip labels.

3) Geological Linework_100k_ITM_2018: A line shapefile that contains structural geological line work codes, stratigraphic geological line codes and descriptions and map sheet cross sections as per paper printed maps. This dataset also contains Lexicon information.

4) Bedrock outcrops_ITM_2018: A polygon shapefile that contains unattributed bedrock outcrops.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Bedrock 1:100,000 digital geological map 2018. This polygon shapefile contains the latest version of the bedrock stratigraphy of the 1:100,000 seamless dataset for the Rep of Ireland at the 1:100,000 scale. Information at the 1:50,000 scale is also included from sheets 24, 26, 27.1,28.1 32, 33, 34, 35, 39 and 40.

themeKeys.keyword: Bedrock, geology, geoscience, bedrock aquifers, geological map

attr.attrdef: Use this field code to colour the map by applying the Bedrock_master100k_2016_v1.style. Labels can also be added from Unit names.
This field provides and index for 100k and 50k sheets.
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

overview.eaover: Fields: AREA: Area of the polygon in square metres. Field type: Double. PERIMETER: Perimeter of polygons in metres: Field type: Double. NEWCODE: unique identifier for every formation or member. This field is used to color the map applying the 'Bedrock_master100k_2016_v1.style'. Labels on unit_names can be simultaneously added from symbology. Field type: String. SHEETNO: 100k sheets from which they originated before creating the seamless version. Field type: Double. STRATCODE: Stratigraphic code for unit, as labeled on printed maps and their legends. Field type: String. LITHCODE: Lithological code. Field type: String. DESCRIPT: Brief description of the dominant rock types. Field type: String. C,M,Y,K: cyan, magenta, yellow and black percentage. Field types: Double. UNITNAME: Name of the geological formation or member. Field Type: String. RU_GPR: Rock unit category. Field type: String AQCAT: Aquifer category. Field type: String AQtype: Aquifer type. Field type: String AQDESC: Description of the aquifer. Field type: String CKcomments: Aquifer comments. Field type: String AqCatOrig: comments on previous classification of the aquifer. Field type: String Label: Formation label. Field type: String

dataLineage.statement:
The lineage of this version involved several phases Initially, three phases were necessary to create a seamless dataset.
Phase 1:
Data capture & compilation was performed by Bedrock Section. Data was collected both internally by GSI and also from external data sources.
Digital data capture methods were a combination of manual and heads up digitising using OS 1:10,560 map scale in AutoCAD 12.0. Generated CAD compilation layers were then referenced to OS digital raster 1:100, 000 scale base.
Base Map The base maps were supplied by OSi. The OS 1:100,000 scale raster base originated from from OSi 1/2'' 1:126.720. They were scanned from photographic enlargements of the 1/2'' map scale and suppplied in TIFF format with world files. GSI has since converted TIFF to GeoTIFF format.
Copyright GSI is under a copyright agreement with OSi and pay a annual royalty to OSi for the use of their base data. GSI under copyright are not permitted to supply OSi base data as part of GSI datasets to interested third party groups.
Bedrock Section utilised a vector cookie cutter with the OS raster basemap @ 1:100,000 scale that established geology to coastline high water mark and exclusion around digitised water bodies. 1:50,000 scale was not available for entire country at commencement of this project.
Phase 2:
Cartography Section introduced ArcInfo GIS on UNIX in 1994 and commenced implementation of 1:100, 000 scale Bedrock digital mapping programme, (21 map sheets total coverage). The map series encompassed the bedrock geology of the Republic of Ireland with some geology overlapping of Northern Ireland.
Map sheet No.'s 1&2, 3&4 and 8&9 are single digital map sheets that also share part of the territory of Northern Ireland.
Bedrock AutoCAD layers were converted to .dxf format and imported into ArcInfo 7.x. For each map sheet ArcInfo aml, filtered out relevant Bedrock AutoCad layers to generate new ArcInfo coverages. Coverage creation were also registered to cookie cutter and 1:100, 000 monochrome raster basemap used by Bedrock Section.
A bedrock database file in ascii format accompanied CAD file
Each map sheet commenced in ArcInfo generated new geological coverages representing Stratigraphy, Lithology, Igneous, Diagenetic, Dynamic, Thermal, Geological Linework and Point symbol data.
Bedrock Database was imported for each map sheet into ArcInfo LU tables in ASCII format to permit population of geological codes in coverages and geological legend generation . New coverages were then created, coded and edited.
Each set of map sheet coverages were combined with OS 1:100,000 digital base to create geological maps with full marginalia.
All map sheets are available in paper copy accompanied by geological report.
In excess of 200 ArcInfo coverages were created on completion of the map series in 2003.
All ArcInfo coverages were converted to shapfile format.
Phase 3:
2002, Cartography introduced ArcGIS 8.x to undertake necessary seamless geoprocessing exercise on map sheet by sheet basis. The following layers were utilisd from original ArcInfo coverage map layers.
Stratigraphy Igneous Lithology Diagenetic Geological Linework
The geological linework was divided into two separate shape files.
Structural units Stratigraphic units
The original ArcInfo coverages had a limited number of fields and did not possess unique code identifier. A new coding system was introduced to establish unique code field called 'NEWCODE'.
All Bedrock section's data from their main database at this time (Dataflex) was converted to Microsoft Access. A procedure was then used to join and populate additional records as map sheets were been added and merged.
Sheet joins and editing then commenced and quality control checks were introduced at interval and final stages.
All relevant symbology was created and customised in ArcGIS. The relevant customised symbol library style file is called 'gis100k.style'
Phase 4: Bedrock 1:100,000 scale digital geological map This data represents a seamless bedrock geological dataset encompassing Rep of Ireland and parts of Northern Ireland. The seamless geological dataset was created from Bedrock 1:100,000 scale digital geological map series. The dataset comprises 6 key shape files. 1) Final100kunion.shp - A polygon shapefile that contains bedrock geological information on Stratigraphy, Igneous, Lithology and Diagentic codes, their unitnames and descriptions, 2) Index100Map.shp - An overlay polygon index of 1:100,000 scale map sheets to permit sheet number identification at 100,000 scale. 3) Final100kstruc.shp (Structural Linework) - A linework shapefile that contains structural geological linework codes and descriptions 4) Final100kstra.shp (Stratigraphic Linework) - A linework shapefile that contains stratigraphic geological line codes and descriptions. 5) Cross100ksection (Crosss section) - A linework shapefile that contains map sheet cross sections as per paper printed maps and dynamic links to map sheet cross sections in bitmap image format. 6) Final100kmin.shp - A point shapefile contains selected mineral and quarry descriptions from Bedrock 1:100,000 map series. The original map series and seamless dataset is based on Â© Ordnance Survey topological map base at 1:100,000 scale. The topological base maps are not seamless and are represented as 1 bit monochrome .tif image format.
Phase 5: Bedrock 1:100,000 scale digital geological map 2016 This data represents the latest version of the bedrock geological dataset for the Rep of Ireland at the 1:100,000 scale digital geological map series. Some information at the 1:50,000 scale from sheets 28A, 77 and parts of Dublin and Galway is also included. The dataset comprises 6 key shape files. 1) Bedrock100k_ITM_2016_V1.shp - A polygon shapefile that contains bedrock geological information on Stratigraphy, Igneous, Lithology and Digenetic codes, their unit names and descriptions. It also contains Bedrock aquifer categories2) Index100k_50k_ITM_v1.shp - An overlay polygon index of 1:100,000 and 1:50,000 scale map sheets to permit sheet number identification at 100,000 and 50, 000 scale. 3) Strat_Struct_lines_ITM_2016_v1.shp.- A line work shapefile that contains structural geological line work codes, stratigraphic geological line codes and descriptions and map sheet cross sections as per paper printed maps. 4) Min100k_ITM_2016.shp - A point shapefile contains selected mineral and quarry descriptions from Bedrock 1:100,000 map series. 5) Symbols_labels_ITM_2016_v1.shp a line work shapefile that contains all symbols and dip labels. 6) Coastline_2013.shp is the most updated coastline (ITM) provided by OSi (2013). The rationale for creating this version was: to migrate from bedrock map in Irish National Grid (IG) to Irish transverse Mercator (ITM) projection; adding a new irish coastline (ITM); filling geology in water bodies; locating and amending discrepancies between paper maps and digital version; modifying and incorporating new geology at the 50k scale; adding bedrock aquifer categories; creating and updating a unified master stylefile; clean data topologically. Data processing steps below.
Phase 6: Release of the second version on the Bedrock 1:100,000 scale digital geological map 2018. New information from 50k sheets were added (24, 26, 27.1,28.1 32, 33, 34, 35, 39 and 40, corresponding to the counties of Sligo, Mayo, Roscommon, Galway, Leitrim, Cavan, Louth, Meath, Monaghanand Longford). Next four new files were created. 1) Bedrock Polygons_v2_2018.shp.- A polygon shapefile that contains bedrock geological information on Stratigraphy, Igneous, Lithology and Diagentic codes, their unitnames and descriptions. It also contains Bedrock aquifer categories. This dataset also contains Lexicon_Polygons. 2) Geological_Linework_v22018.shp.- A linework shapefile that contains structural geological linework codes,stratigraphic geological line codes and descriptionsand map sheet cross sections as per paper printed maps. This dataset also contains Lexicon_Linework. 3) Structural_Symbols_v22018.shp a point shapefile that contains all symbols and dip labels 4) Min_100k_v22018.shp contains mineral and quarry descriptions from Bedrock 1:100,000 map series. This is a subset of the MINLOCS database held by Minerals Section in the GSI.

prcStep.stepDesc: 1. Conversion from Irish National Grid (TM65) to IRENET95 Irish Transversal Mercator Final100kunion.shp, Index100Map.shp, Final100kstruc.shp (Structural Linework), Final100kstra.shp (Stratigraphic Linework), Cross100ksection.shp (cross section) and Final100kmin.shp (mine localities) were converted into ITM (Europe> IRENET95 Irish Transversal) using ArcEditor>Arctoolbox> projection and Transformations. Transformation equation is TM65_To_ETRS_1989_ntV2+IRENET95_to_ERTS_1989.

2. New information at the 50k scale for Dublin (part of sheets 43 and 50), Galway (part of sheets 45, 46, 51 and 52), sheet 28A and 77 was added to Final100kunion.shp using Arctoolbox>Analysis tools>overlay> Union to create a new polygon map called 'Final100kunionDUGA28A_Union2.shp'.

3. Map to be topologically clean A new file geodatabase called '100_50GEO.gdb' was created that included new bedrock file, new coastline and also struct and strat linework. Then a topology (GEO_topology) that stated three restrictions: 'polygons should not overlap', file ' polygons should not have gaps' and two files 'must cover each other', was generated creating over 41473 errors. After adding a new coastline and new 50k geological information 43,300 topo errors reamined to be fixed. Using the topological tool errors gaps, slievers, overlaps were first fixed around the coast.Once all coastline slivers were fixed (deleted or added), 37.000 new polygons needed to be accommodated into the map.Therefore new blank polygons were splitted or merged, and finally incorporated into the map. Topology was validated again to ensure to errors disappeared.
4. Water bodies (lakes and rivers) were infilled with geology using geological interpreation.

5. Differences in geological units classification, stratigraphy or structural lines were compared with paper sheets. Errors were amended in the digital version. Consequently Stratcode, lithcodes, Unitnames, Newcode, SheetNo and M,Y,K,C fields changed.

6.Stratigraphy or structural linework shapfiles were doubled check against new 50k information and attribute tables were cleaned and fields reorganised. Errors were amended for Lithocode, Stratcode, dykelabel and sheet fields. New fields 'categories, and 'subcategories' were added for detailed/symplified classification, and also STYLE and labelstyle to color map and label respectively were introduced in Final100kstra.shp. Similarly New fields 'STYLE' and 'labelstyle' were added to Final100kstru.shp and Sect100k.shp files.
7. Stratigraphic and structural lines together with cross-sections were merge into a single shapefile called 'Linework_new6', after called Strat_Struct_lines_ITM_2016_v1.shp
8. Symbols100k.shp containing structural symbology and Labels100k.shp with dip information, were joint into a table Symbols_labels2016. Finally called Symbols_labels_ITM_2016_v1.shp

9. A new index file containing 100k and 50k sheet information was created 'Index100k_50k_v2_ITM.shp'. This dataset includes a field called 'style' to colour future point based style files. 'Label' field contains dip data.

10. New master style file ('100kBed-Sil20152.style') was initially created to colour polygons (using Fill symbols), linework and min locations (using Line symbols), and symbols (using Marker symbols). Style was amended to accomodate discrepancies between paper maps and digital version and also to include future 50k information. Final stylefile was called 'Bedrock_master100k_2016_v1'.
prcStep.stepRat: A unified master style file to colour all files included into 100k and 50k dataset was needed.

prcStep.stepDesc: 11. Aquifer categories were incorporated into the new Bedrock 1:100,000 scale digital geological map 2016. -New fields were added â€˜RU_GRP', 'AQCAT', 'AQDESC', 'AQTYPE', 'CKComments' and 'AqCatorigin'. -The Rockunit (descriptions for 27 rock unit groups) were assigned based on the 'NEWCODE' field by using selection by attribute/location tools and different combination of NEWCODE/ROCKUNIT using latest aquifer map (Aquifer_final_May29_2012_itm.shp) as a base map and overlapping and selecting same polygons from Final100kUnion.shp so 'RU_GRP', 'AQCAT', 'AQDESC', 'AQTYPE', 'CKComments' and 'AqCatorigin' could be populated. New version of the bedrock geological map contained at this stage new geological unit_names/NEWCODEâ€™s and therefore aquifer description needed to be amended accordingly and as new version did not coincide with old geological layout outlined from Aquifer map. Consequently new aquifer categories were modified and new entered, in many cases populated manually. -New Aquifer cat were double check against new geology.
prcStep.stepRat: Geological map has been evolving through the years and now greatly differs from original geological information included in former National bedrock Aquifer map (Aquifer_final_May29_2012_itm.shp). Most of changes came from latest work on creating the new version of the geological map (ie: new coastline (including new islands) and geology in GW bodies was reinterpreted, mismatches, topological errors). Other errors were carried over from former versions of the geological map. Therefore Aquifer rock units and categories needed an update.

prcStep.stepDesc: 12. New attributes from the LEXICON tables were incorporated through the NEWCODE (Rock type, age,comments, reference, etc)

Process step 13: -New 50k information was added. -Geology was adjusted across the border. -Errors spotted from external enquires were amended. -New topology was run. -Missalignment of structural linework with new polygons was amended. -Aquifers categories were assigned. -Master Style file was updated.
